summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a former Captain of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview was part of an official OIG investigation and includes references to numerous attachments such as assignment rosters, count documentation, and facility maps from August 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; he was an inmate housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York who died while in custody.

events.title: OIG Interview of Former MCC Captain
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview with a former Captain of the MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Referenced through attached documents: Daily Assignment Roster and inmate count documentation from the MCC New York, the day before Epstein's death.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Referenced through attached documents: Daily Assignment Roster and multiple inmate count documentation (12 a.m., 3 a.m., 5 a.m.) from the MCC New York, the day of Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, New York
Federal Correctional Institution (FCI) Fort Dix, New Jersey
FCI Fort Dix West Side Administrative Building, New Jersey
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an official investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The interview subject was the Captain at the MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.
The memorandum references specific documentation from August 9-10, 2019, including daily assignment rosters and inmate count sheets, which are critical to the timeline of Epstein's death.
The document states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, indicating it is a factual record of an interview as part of an ongoing investigation.
The identities of the interviewing agents and the interviewee are redacted in the provided text.
